text: カイネ、お前の体はもう、俺の意思ではどうにもならぬところまで蝕まれてる
translation: Kaine, your body has already been corrupted to a point where my will can do nothing about it.

vocabulary.meaning: nothing can be done (archaic form of どうにもならない)
to be eroded/corrupted (passive of 蝕む)

grammar: ~ぬ is an archaic/literary negative form equivalent to ~ない. This is characteristic of the Shade Tyrann's speech. 蝕まれてる is the contracted form of 蝕まれている (passive progressive).

text: わかってる
translation: I know.

vocabulary.meaning: I understand (casual contraction of わかっている)

grammar: ~てる is the casual contraction of ~ている, indicating ongoing state or awareness.

text: クソ、楽しかったな / 殺して殺して殺して、大満足だ
translation: Damn, it was fun. / Killing and killing and killing - I'm completely satisfied.

vocabulary.meaning: was fun (past tense of 楽しい)

grammar: Repeating the te-form (殺して殺して殺して) emphasizes continuous/repeated action. 大~ is a prefix meaning 'great/complete'.

text: そうか
translation: I see.
grammar: A common acknowledgment phrase, often implying thoughtful acceptance.

text: 違う、違う、違う、楽しくなんかない
translation: No, no, no, it's not fun at all.

vocabulary.meaning: such a thing as, something like (dismissive)

grammar: ~くなんかない is an emphatic negation pattern. なんか adds dismissive emphasis: 'not ~ at all' or 'there's no way it's ~'.

text: お前を飲み込んで暴力の塊になって
translation: Swallowing you up and becoming a mass of violence...
grammar: Two te-forms (飲み込んで...なって) chain actions together, setting up for what follows.

text: 悪意を世界に撒き散らせるっていうのに / なんでこんなに虚しいんだ / なんでこんなに悲しいんだ
translation: Even though I could scatter malice throughout the world... / Why do I feel so empty? / Why do I feel so sad?
grammar: ~っていうのに expresses frustrated contradiction: 'even though' with emotional weight. ~んだ at the end adds explanatory/emotional emphasis to the rhetorical questions.

text: きっと
translation: Surely...

text: 私の中に長く居すぎたせいだな
translation: It's because you've been inside me for too long.

vocabulary.meaning: to be, to exist (for animate things)

grammar: ~すぎる attached to verb stem means 'to do too much'. ~せいだ indicates cause/blame: 'it's because of ~'.

text: すまない
translation: I'm sorry.
grammar: すまない is a masculine apology form, literally meaning 'it won't end/settle' - implying the debt cannot be repaid.

text: 俺に優しくしないでくれ
translation: Don't be kind to me.
grammar: ~ないでくれ is a request not to do something. 優しくする means 'to treat kindly' or 'to be kind to'.

text: こんな気持ちにさせないでくれ
translation: Don't make me feel this way.
grammar: ~させないでくれ combines causative (させる) with the negative request form. 気持ちにさせる means 'to make someone feel'.

text: もう
translation: Already...

text: だめだ
translation: It's no good.

text: 俺がお前を飲み込んでしまう
translation: I'm going to swallow you up.

vocabulary.meaning: to end up doing (often with regret)

grammar: ~てしまう expresses completion of an action, often with regret or indicating something unfortunate/inevitable.

text: カイネ / どうしたんだ
translation: Kaine! / What's wrong?
grammar: どうしたんだ is a common concerned inquiry meaning 'what happened?' or 'what's wrong?'

text: いいか
translation: Listen.
grammar: いいか is used to get someone's attention before saying something important.

text: 今から言うことを / よく聞いてくれ
translation: Listen carefully to what I'm about to say.
grammar: ~てくれ is a direct request form, more forceful than ~てください but less harsh than plain imperative.

text: 私の / 左半身の / 魔物の
translation: My... / left side's... / the Shade's...
grammar: The の particles chain possessive/descriptive relationships. The fragmented delivery shows Kaine struggling to speak.

text: 領域が / 広がっている
translation: ...territory is... spreading.
grammar: ~ている indicates ongoing action/state.

text: もう間もなく私は暴走してしまう / もう止められない
translation: Very soon I'm going to lose control. / I can't stop it anymore.

vocabulary.meaning: to go berserk, to run wild

grammar: ~てしまう with 暴走 emphasizes the regrettable inevitability. 止められない is the negative potential form.

text: もう俺には止められないんだ
translation: I can't stop it anymore.
grammar: ~には with potential negative emphasizes the person's inability: 'even I cannot...'

text: そんな / いいから聞け
translation: No way... / Never mind that, just listen!

vocabulary.meaning: such, that kind of; here: 'no way!'
never mind that, it's fine so...

grammar: いいから dismisses objections: 'that's enough, just...' 聞け is the plain imperative, showing urgency.

text: もうエミールはいない / 私を止める方法はないんだ
translation: Emil is no longer here. / There's no way to stop me.

vocabulary.meaning: is not here, does not exist
there is not, does not exist

grammar: ~方法はない means 'there is no way to ~'. んだ adds emotional weight to the statement.

text: お願いが
translation: I have a request...
grammar: An incomplete sentence, trailing off. が suggests something follows.

text: そうなる前に私を殺せ
translation: Kill me before that happens.

vocabulary.meaning: to become that way, to turn out like that

grammar: ~前に means 'before ~'. 殺せ is the imperative form of 殺す, showing desperate urgency.

text: 最後に頼んだからな
translation: This is my final request, okay?

vocabulary.meaning: to request, to ask a favor

grammar: ~からな adds masculine emphasis, here conveying 'I'm counting on you' or 'don't forget'.

text: ダメだ!止まらないんだよ!
translation: No! I can't stop!
grammar: んだよ combines explanatory の with emphatic よ, expressing frustration or urgency.

text: 暴走したゲシュタルトに意識なんかない! / お前と俺の記憶は全部塗りつぶされちまうんだ!
translation: A Gestalt that's gone berserk has no consciousness! / All memories of you and me will be completely erased!

vocabulary.meaning: doesn't have at all, no such thing as
to paint over, to black out, to obliterate
casual/rough form of てしまう

grammar: ~なんかない is emphatic negation. ~ちまう is a rough/masculine contraction of ~てしまう, expressing regrettable completion.

text: カイネ!
translation: Kaine!

text: くそ!何とかしないと!
translation: Damn! I have to do something!

vocabulary.meaning: to do something about it, to manage somehow

grammar: 何とかしないと is short for 何とかしないといけない - 'I have to do something about it'.

text: 殺さない!
translation: I won't kill you!
grammar: Plain negative form used as emphatic refusal.

text: カイネがいたからここまで来れたんだ / お前に出会えたから今の俺があるんだ
translation: I was able to come this far because Kaine was with me. / The me that exists now is because I met you.

vocabulary.meaning: was there, existed (past of いる)
the current me, who I am now

grammar: ~から...んだ expresses emotional reasoning. 来れた and 出会えた are potential past forms showing gratitude for what became possible.

text: 絶対に諦めたりしないからな / 愛する人一人も助けられないで
translation: I'll never give up, you hear me! / Without being able to save even one person I love...

vocabulary.meaning: to give up, to abandon hope
won't do things like giving up

grammar: ~たりしない means 'won't do things like ~', emphasizing absolute refusal. 一人も...ない means 'not even one person'.

text: 俺が必ずお前を助ける
translation: I will definitely save you.

vocabulary.meaning: to save, to help, to rescue

grammar: 俺が emphasizes the subject - 'I (personally) will...'

text: 助ける方法ならある
translation: There is a way to save her.

vocabulary.meaning: if it's, as for, speaking of

grammar: ~ならある means 'if you're asking about ~, there is one' - implies 'there IS a way, but...'

text: 誰だ
translation: Who are you?
grammar: Blunt, masculine way of asking identity.

text: そんなことはどうでもいい / 時間がないのだ / いいか よく聞け
translation: That doesn't matter. / There's no time. / Listen carefully.
grammar: のだ (formal version of んだ) adds authoritative explanation. 聞け is the plain imperative.

text: お前は
translation: You...
grammar: Incomplete sentence, interrupted or trailing off.

text: 聞け / カイネを助ける方法はある
translation: Listen! / There is a way to save Kaine.

text: だがお前にとって / それはつらい選択になるな
translation: But for you... / it will be a painful choice.
grammar: ~にとって means 'for someone' or 'from someone's perspective'.

text: 構わない / 助ける方法があるならさっさと言ってくれ
translation: I don't care. / If there's a way to save her, hurry up and tell me.
grammar: 構わない shows dismissal of concerns. さっさと is an adverb showing impatience.

text: タイミングを見て / 俺がカイネの動きを止める
translation: Watch for the timing. / I'll stop Kaine's movements.
grammar: タイミングを見て means 'watching for the right moment' or 'when the timing is right'.

text: その隙を逃すな / 剣できっちり刺せ / そんなことしたら、カイネはどうなる?
translation: Don't miss that opening. / Stab her precisely with your sword. / If I do that, what will happen to Kaine?

vocabulary.meaning: what will happen, what becomes of

grammar: ~な after dictionary form is negative imperative (don't do). ~たら is conditional (if).

text: 俺を信じられないか。ならば、このままカイネを見殺しにするのだな
translation: Can't you trust me? Then you'll just let Kaine die like this.

vocabulary.meaning: as is, like this, as things are
letting someone die, abandoning to death

grammar: ならば is a formal/literary conditional 'if so'. 見殺しにする is an idiom meaning 'to stand by and watch someone die'.

text: くそ!
translation: Damn!

text: (戦闘シーン)
translation: (Battle scene)

text: ん
translation: (Sound/grunt)

text: よくやった / お前の大切なカイネを救うには
translation: Well done. / To save your precious Kaine...

vocabulary.meaning: in order to, for the purpose of

grammar: ~には indicates purpose: 'in order to ~'.

text: 2つの方法がある / 一つ
translation: There are two methods. / One...

text: カイネの胸に剣を突き立てる方法 / それはカイネの望みでもある
translation: The method of thrusting a sword into Kaine's chest. / That is also Kaine's wish.

vocabulary.meaning: to thrust into, to stab upright

grammar: ~でもある means 'is also ~', implying there's more to it.

text: この苦痛からの解放 / もう一つ / カイネを元の人間に戻す方法
translation: Liberation from this suffering. / The other one... / The method to return Kaine to being a normal human.

vocabulary.meaning: to return, to restore, to put back

grammar: ~からの解放 means 'liberation from ~'. 元の~に戻す means 'to restore to the original ~'.

text: この方法を取るなら / お前の存在という代償が必要だ
translation: If you choose this method... / The price of your existence is required.
grammar: ~という indicates equivalence or explanation: 'the price which is your existence'.

text: ほら、選んでみろよ / お前はカイネの中にいる魔物だな
translation: Go on, try choosing. / You're the Shade inside Kaine, aren't you?
grammar: ~てみろ is the rough imperative of ~てみる (to try doing). だな seeks confirmation.

text: なぜカイネを助けようとする? / たぶん、お前と同じ理由だ
translation: Why are you trying to save Kaine? / Probably the same reason as you.

vocabulary.meaning: to try to, to attempt to

grammar: ~ようとする means 'to try to do ~' or 'to be about to do ~'.

text: さあ、選べ
translation: Now, choose.
grammar: 選べ is the imperative form of 選ぶ.

text: カイネ
translation: Kaine...

text: カイネ、一緒に帰ろう
translation: Kaine, let's go home together.
grammar: ~よう is the volitional form expressing 'let's ~' or intention.

text: 聞こえるか
translation: Can you hear me?
grammar: 聞こえる is the potential/spontaneous form - 'is audible' or 'can be heard'.

text: 俺は長年カイネの中にあって / 奴を苦しめてきた
translation: For many years I've been inside Kaine... / and I've been tormenting her.

vocabulary.meaning: being (te-form of ある, used for existence)

grammar: ~てきた indicates an action that has been ongoing from the past until now.

text: それはすなわち / カイネの苦しみを肌で感じてきたということだ
translation: That means... / I've felt Kaine's suffering firsthand.

vocabulary.meaning: in other words, that is to say, namely
to feel firsthand, to experience directly
it means that, in other words

grammar: 肌で感じる is an idiom literally meaning 'to feel with one's skin' - to experience directly/firsthand. すなわち is a formal connector meaning 'in other words'.

text: 気が遠くなるほどの苦しみを
translation: Suffering so great it makes you faint.

vocabulary.meaning: to feel faint, to lose consciousness
to the extent that, so much that

grammar: 気が遠くなる is an idiom meaning 'to feel faint' or 'overwhelming'. ~ほどの expresses extent: 'suffering to the degree that one would faint'.

text: だから分かるのだ / 今 カイネに苦しみはない
translation: That's why I understand. / Right now, Kaine has no suffering.
grammar: のだ adds explanatory tone - 'the reason I understand is because...'

text: お前のおかげで カイネは許され 救われた
translation: Thanks to you, Kaine was forgiven and saved.
grammar: おかげで indicates gratitude for a positive outcome. Both verbs are in passive form showing Kaine as the recipient of these actions.

text: カイネの最後の言葉を伝えよう
translation: Let me convey Kaine's last words.

vocabulary.meaning: to convey, to tell, to communicate

grammar: ~よう (volitional) here expresses intention: 'I will/let me ~'.

text: ありがとう
translation: Thank you.

text: カイネ
translation: Kaine...

text: (エンディング曲)
translation: (Ending song)

text: (エンディング曲 - カオス言語)
translation: (Ending song - Chaos Language)
grammar: The ending theme uses the game's constructed 'Chaos Language', a fictional language created for the NieR series soundtrack.
